text:
The exterior angle theorem states that \(\angle BCD\) (the exterior angle at \(C\)) is equal to the sum of the remote interior angles \(\angle BAC\) and \(\angle ABC\):
   \[
   110^\circ = y + x
   \]
3.
class-1-reason: This paragraph systematically sets up the equations from angle relationships and directly solves for the variables using clear algebraic steps with no uncertainty or checking of correctness. It advances the solution confidently.

text:
Solving the system of equations:
   \[
   \begin{cases}
   2y + x = 180^\circ \\
   y + x = 110^\circ
   \end{cases}
   \]
   Subtract the second equation from the first:
   \[
   (2y + x) - (y + x) = 180^\circ - 110^\circ \implies y = 70^\circ
   \]
4.
